metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2190 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The translate_hierarchy_event function in x11/clutter-device-manager-xi2.c in Clutter, when resuming the system, does not properly handle XIQueryDevice errors when a device has "disappeared," which causes the gnome-shell to crash and allows physically proximate attackers to access the previous gnome-shell session via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clutter-1.0-tests - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
gir1.2-clutter-1.0 - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
libclutter-1.0-0 - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
libclutter-1.0-common - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clutter-1.0 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.4-0ubuntu2').
